caption.p: Concentration-response curves of Ca ++ in the absence (control) and presence of the increasing concentrations of (A) Thymus serrulatus essential oil (TS Oil) and (B) verapamil in isolated guinea-pig tracheal preparations. The values shown are mean ± SEM of 3–4 individual experiments conducted on the isolated tracheal tissue preparations from 3 to 4 different guinea-pigs. * p < 0.05, ** p < 0.01, and *** p < 0.001 shows comparison of the mean of Ca ++-mediated contractions in the pretreated tissues with TS Oil. (A) and verapamil, (B) with the respective mean of Ca ++-mediated contractions in control (untreated) tracheal tissues (Repeated Measures ANOVA, followed by Bonferroni post-test).
